alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Schoharie County through 430 PM EDT... At 352 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sharon Springs to near Summit to near East Meredith. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Middleburgh, Gilboa, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Preston-Potter Hollow, Seward, Conesville, Zeh Corners, West Richmondville, Baird Corners, Warnerville, Gardnersville and Broome Center. This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
